"Darien Connors discovers he's not from Earth, has strange magical powers, and is the key in an ancient war between two alien races of necromancers. 'Star Mage' offers wizard battles with a side of spaceship warfare, alien worlds, and weird creatures."

9.title: "The Strange Second Life of Jimmy Olsen"

9.appears_in: 15 p. in Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen, no. 157 (Mar. 1973) ; reprinted in The Best of DC, no. 46 (Mar. 1984).

Data from Bill Wormstedt, Allen Ross, Mike Nielsen et al. via Grand Comics Database.

95.heading: Star Print Brokers.
95.title: Doors of Chaos
95.author: by Ryoko Mitsuki ; translation, Adrienne Beck ; English adaptation, Shannon Foreman ; retouch and lettering, Star Print Brokers.
notes: Translation of: Gurenshen Tyûa.

"When all the doors open, the world will slip into chaos. Only the twins Clarissa (open) and Mizeria (close) control the Four Doors that protect the world from descending into chaos. When Rikhter, their guardian, kidnaps Clarissa, he weakens the Door of Chaos and demons begin to pour through, threatening to destroy the entire kingdom. Will Mizeria find her sister in time to close the door and restore order to the world?"

96.heading: Star Print Brokers.
96.title: In the End
96.author: Pink Psycho, Heath & Nheira ; translation, Erin M
96.appears_in: Blakemore ; English adaptation, Barb Lien-Cooper ; retouch and lettering, Star Print Brokers.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 19 cm.

Summary (from OCLC): Goth high school student Kaito Niikura skips school, does drugs, and ignores his parents because he feels that no one cares about him, but when he meets an empathic teacher named Ren Ando, all of that might change.

97.heading: Star Print Brokers.
97.title: Phantom Dream
97.author: by Natsuki Takaya ; translation, Beni Axia Conrad ; English adaptation, Ysabet Reinhardt MacFarlane ; retouch and lettering, Star Print Brokers.
notes: Translation of: Genei Musô.
Complete in 5 vols.

"Tamaki Otoya is the last in a line of ancient summoners tasked to battle against evil forces that threaten mankind. Burdened by his duty as a summoner, Tamaki has always found strength from his childhood friend Asahi, with whom he has a deep, emotional bond. So when Asahi's friend is found out to be possessed by a demon, he awakens
as the one destined to exorcise demons out of tortured human souls."

98.heading: Star Print Brokers.
98.title: The Secret Notes of Lady Kanoko
98.author: by Ririko Tsujita ; translation, Ray Yoshimoto ; English adaptation, Ysabet Reinhardt MacFarlane ; retouch and lettering, Star Print Brokers ; production artist, Rui Kyo.
notes: "It's high school meets nature documentary in this new shojo comedy! Kanoko Naedoko, a third-year student in junior high, doesn't make friends and keeps to herself. Which is fine by her because then she can be the ideal 'objective observer'. Steamy love triangles, school gossip and courtyard politics only mean more data for Lady Kanoko! But when she befriends some of her classmates, what will happen to Kanoko? Will she become more than just an observer?"

201.title: Star Pirate
notes:
Science fiction feature in Planet Comics (1941-1950, reprints to 1953) and as reprints in Jumbo Comics in 1952. Art credits as pieced together from the Grand Comics Database Project include:
  • Murphy Anderson (Nov. 1944 - Sept. 1945, Jan. 1946 - Nov. 1947)
  • George Appel (May 1941, Nov. 1941 - Mar. 1944, July 1944)
  • Pagsilang Rey Isip (July-Sept. 1941)
  • Jack Keller (Nov. 1945)
  • Joe Kubert (Sept. 1944)
  • John Rosenberger (Winter 1949)
  • Leonard Starr (Mar.-July 1949)
  • George Tuska (May 1944)
  • Maurice Whitman (Mar. 1948 - Jan. 1949, Sept. 1949?)
